page.title: 13Life in Charnock Richard
page.content: Charnock Richard is a small village surrounded by flat, fertile countryside. Most is grassland and trees. There is abundant wild-life. On nice days you can go for walks. There are two schools, a new primary school and the former village school, now used for playschool, youth-club and clinic. Discos are held in the new school once a fortnight. There are football teams for all ages, guides, Brownies, Scouts and Cubs. a Rambling Club and a Gardening Club. Many events are connected with the church such as Walking Day and Fairs and Fetes. The shops are Brennands greengrocers and florists, The Mini-Market, The Post Office, Harold's grocers and a Hairdressing Parlour. The pubs are The Dog and Partridge, The Hind's Head and The Bowling Green. We have a funfair at Park Hall called Camelot.
